page.title: 17Local History
page.content: Lacock is a village full of history. It is owned by the{National Trust}and conservation is the main preoccupation. Little is allowed to change or develop as it is the quaint, picturesque side of the village which attracts the tourists. {Lacock abbey}is a must for all visitors to the village. This proudly boasts the window which formed the subject of the first negative taken by{Fox Talbot,} This connects well with the neighbouring{Fox Talbot {Museum of Photography}which houses a fascinating collection of old photographs of the area. Also of interest in the village is a barn which is believed to have been a{tithe {barn}and most of the houses.
